programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Road to the Runway" - Zanna Roberts Rassi introduces everyone to 16 new designers who will be competing against each other on Project Runway Season 11.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "There is No I in Team" - After just meeting each other for the first time, the designers are placed in two teams of eight and told that they will be designing in teams for the entire season. For the first challenge, the designers must create unique and individual looks inspired by NYC. They are judged on how well they do as a team...and the team is only as strong as it's weakest link.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Spin Out" - The two teams are tasked with designing new uniforms for the popular nightclub/ping pong club Spin. The winning design will be worn by Spin employees. Susan Sarandon appears as a guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Surprise Me" - The teams are presented with the challenge and privilege of designing a look for Heidi to wear in her ad campaign and for press events while promoting her new fragrance "Surprise". Two designers win the challenge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Ultimate Hard and Soft" - The designers are tasked with the Unconventional Materials Challenge. Two of Project Runway's favorite challenges, the flower store and the hardware store, are combined for the ultimate "hard and soft" challenge. Also, the teams get a bit of a shake-up when two members leave one team and one member leaves another. The legendary Bette Midler serves as a guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "A Little Bit Country, A Little Bit Rock N Roll" - The large teams dissolve, and the designers are now asked to work in pairs. The teams must make two looks—one red carpet and one performance—for country music star Miranda Lambert.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Senior Fling" - The designers must work in teams of two to create looks for "mature" women, who also serve as their clients and models for this challenge. Joan and Melissa Rivers guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "A Sticky Situation" - Before the challenge begins, the designers are asked to re-pick their teams. Then, in teams of two, the designers are tasked with making a prom dress out of duct tape. In addition to the Runway, they are also judged on their work by a group of high school students, whose votes factor into their final score. Two designers are eliminated.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Take it All Off" - Regrouping once again, the judges decide which designers they would like to see work together, and the teams are separated into two teams of four. The designers must make cohesive looks for the male dance troupe Thunder From Down Under. Not only must they execute menswear, but their designs must be able to "tear away" onstage as part of their performance.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "He Said, She Said" - In new teams of twos and threes, the designers make a ready-to-wear look for Lord and Taylor, inspired by their famous rose design. The winning design is manufactured and sold at Lord and Taylor for Spring 2013.

programme.title: Still
programme.desc: Faced with the day-to-day survival of life outside shelter, a simple request by someone in the group leads to a bizarre but enlightening mission.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: As one group finds what may be an ideal shelter, another group comes to realize that the best protection comes from those around them.

programme.title: Too Far Gone
programme.desc: Just when everything started to calm down at the prison, Rick and his group now face imminent danger and destruction. This time, they might not win.

programme.title: After
programme.desc: As Rick deals with old wounds, members of the prison have to come to terms with their new environment and ask themselves if survival alone is enough.

programme.title: Inmates
programme.desc: The group encounters many obstacles in their quest to find stability and safety, but sometimes all they have to guide them is hope.

programme.title: Claimed
programme.desc: Just when Rick thinks he's going to be able to relax, he's faced with multiple immediate threats. Other members of the group deal with their past.

programme.title: Still
programme.desc: Faced with the day-to-day survival of life outside shelter, a simple request by someone in the group leads to a bizarre but enlightening mission.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: As one group finds what may be an ideal shelter, another group comes to realize that the best protection comes from those around them.

programme.title: California: Pacific Coast Highway
programme.desc: On this ride up the PCH, Norman and his friend Imogen check out some beach dune buggies, ride the bike of the future and drop in on a podcast.

programme.title: Lord of the Elves
programme.desc: In an ancient age, the peace-loving Hobbits are enslaved by the Java Men, a race of flesh-eating dragon-riders. The young Hobbit Goben must join forces with their neighbor giants, the humans, to free his people and vanquish their enemies.

programme.title: Sinbad And The War Of The Furies
programme.desc: On a treasure hunt gone wrong, modern-day adventurer Sinbad accidentally releases the Furies, three beautiful but terrible ancient beings powerful enough to threaten life on Earth.

programme.title: Titanic II
programme.desc: On the 100th anniversary of the original voyage, a modern luxury liner christened "Titanic II," follows the path of its namesake. But when a tsunami hurls an ice berg into the new ship's path, the passengers and crew must fight to avoid a similar fate.

programme.title: Trolland
programme.desc: Fenn the Troll hates the Troll pastime of pranking, and is teased so much for it that he runs away. But when a long-suffering park ranger starts capturing the other Trolls, it's up to Fenn to rescue his family and friends - without pranking.

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: Astronomer George Herbert (C. Thomas Howell) is assigned to investigate reports of strange meteors crashing into earth near New York, Los Angeles and Washington, D.C. As the meteors land, enormous multi-limbed metal creatures disembark and begin destroying everything and everyone in their path with heat-ray guns. Amidst the apocalyptic destruction, Herbert teams with a soldier (Andy Lauer) and a pastor (Rhett Giles) on his journey into Washington to reunite with his family.

programme.title: 40 Days and Nights
programme.desc: When a colossal tectonic shift causes the sea level to start rising, a microbiologist gathers the DNA of as many species as she can, while the military creates an "ark" in a desperate attempt to preserve life on Earth.

programme.title: ALTER Collection | The Real World Sucks Vol. 1
programme.desc: Reality is scarier than fiction.

programme.title: ALTER Collection | Women in Horror Vol. 1
programme.desc: Our bodies abused and our minds belittled, these horrors explore the issues that women face in the world. From creepy landlords to gaslighting relationships and everything in between.

programme.title: ALTER Collection | Zombies! Vol. 1
programme.desc: You want em, we got em. Enough zombies to eat your brain out.

programme.title: Amityville: The Evil Escapes
programme.desc: The demonic forces that were lurking in Amityville escape to California by inhabiting a lamp. The evil latches onto a little girl living in the home by manifesting itself as her dead father.

programme.title: Amityville: It's About Time
programme.desc: A widowed father brings an evil antique clock home from a business trip for his teenage kids.

programme.title: Other Space, S1 E1 | Into the Great Beyond... Beyond
programme.desc: Young Stewart Lipinski is made captain of an exploratory space mission into space...his older sister Karen is made his second in command, and is none too happy about it. When their ship and crew stumble into a different universe with no way home, Stewart and Karen have to figure out their differences in order to survive.

programme.title: Other Space, S1 E2 | Getting to Know You
programme.desc: In an attempt to raise the morale of his frightened and fudge-riddled crew, Stewart initiates a bonding session that devolves into ice-breaker games. When Karen discovers that one of the crew members is actually an alien who's implanted memories in their heads, they play a high-stakes game of Mafia to weed out the intruder.

programme.title: Other Space, S1 E3 | The Death of A.R.T.
programme.desc: The crew prepares a video to broadcast to anyone that might be listening in space. ART gets knocked off the ship and then saves the crew when a planet starts to form around the ship.

programme.title: A Christmas Tail
programme.desc: Two single parents fall in love fighting for custody of a dog they both want to give their children as a Christmas gift.

programme.title: Snowmageddon
programme.desc: An Alaskan family receives a mysterious snow globe that causes a global catastrophe. Starring Laura Harris (THE FACULTY) and Michael Hogan (TV's BATTLESTAR GALACTICA).

programme.title: The Tangerine Bear
programme.desc: Tangie, a teddy bear, does his level best over the coming year to become a part of some family. He spends his time in Winkle's front window with Jack, a Jack-in-the-box with claustrophobia and Bird, a cuckoo clock bird with agoraphobia.

programme.title: The Bear Who Slept Through Christmas
programme.desc: While the rest of the world is getting ready for Christmas, all the bears in Bearbank are getting ready to sleep... except for Ted E. Bear. Ted gets curious about Christmas so he learns the meaning from Santa Claus himself.

programme.title: Three Wise Guys
programme.desc: "Twas the night before Christmas" and Murray Crown, owner of the Regal Crown Casino, is spreading anything but Chrismas cheer. To keep his accountant, Leo, from ratting him out to the feds, Murray hires three hit men, wise guys, to shut him up.

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton (Guy Pearce of MOMENTO) heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn (Don Cheadle of CRASH).

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: In the brutal World War II Battle of Saipan, Sergeant Joe Enders (Nicolas Cage) guards -- and befriends -- Ben Yahzee (Adam Beach), a young Navajo trained in the one wartime code never broken by the enemy...the Navajo Code. But if Yahzee should fall into enemy hands, how far will Enders go to save the military's most powerful secret? John Woo directs this action-packed epic inspired by the true story of the Navajo soldiers whose courage and sacrifices helped win the war in the Pacific.

programme.title: Lone Wolf McQuade
programme.desc: A maverick Texas Ranger throws down his guns to indulge his talents in the martial arts when he meets his match in the leader of a gun-smuggling ring.

programme.title: Code of Silence
programme.desc: Chicago detective Eddie Cusack (Chuck Norris) plays by his own rules - a dangerous habit, especially when he breaks the "code of silence" to blow the lid off a deadly police cover-up. Now an outcast, he receives little help from his embittered fellow officers when he's hurled into a blistering battle against rival drug kingpins. But Cusack is a one-man army, waging war on the criminals with his razor-sharp wits, lightning-fast karate moves and a remote-controlled, rocket-equipped tank!

programme.title: Futureworld
programme.desc: Do you remember that disaster at Delos a few years ago when the "Westworld" robots went out of control and killed a few guests? Well, the entire resort has now been rebuilt and redesigned to be completely fail-safe. To combat lingering adverse publicity, the Delos corporation has offered two reporters (Peter Fonda, Blythe Danner) exclusive rights to the "new" Delos story. But as the reporters start their private tour, they get the feeling that the resort may not be as safe as Delos claims...

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation: Karma Chameleon
programme.desc: Ashley feels like an outcast. Nobody's willing to forget how she treated them at her party last year. Ash decides to take action, swallows her pride and apologizes to everyone. And it works. She boasts to Terri about her success- it’s like last year never happened!

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Home Improvement'' - Even during some major construction at the Lucky Dog Ranch, Charlotte, Spirit, and three other dogs undergo life-changing renovations of their own.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Two's Company'' - Some of Brandon's rescued pups find additional purpose, and extra challenges, when they are paired with other dogs.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Life Changers'' - We revisit five of Lucky Dog's most lifesaving and life-changing adoptions, including a hearing-impaired Poodle mix that learns sign language and a Labrador that answers the call of duty for a diabetic veteran.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Livin' the Lifestyle'' - Brandon prepares shelter dogs for their new forever homes by teaching them to participate in activities like swimming, paddle boarding and camping.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''A Higher Purpose'' - Brandon checks in with former students and their adopters to find out how the dogs have been fulfilling a higher purpose as service animals.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Meaningful Matches'' - Brandon rescues five different shelter dogs and trains them for their new forever families. In the end, these people & pet pairings prove to be truly meaningful matches for everyone involved.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''A Family Affair!'' - Brandon doesn't just consider the dog when creating a training plan, he also factors in the dynamic and needs of the forever family. In this episode Brandon revisits some of his most important and heart-warming "family inspired" training moments.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Best of: Ultimate Tests'' - From climbing a mountain to resisting temptation to swimming for safety,every dog that Brandon rescues has a unique set of challenges. And success will mean that they are ready for their new families.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''For Every Problem, There's a Solution'' - Every dog has a unique personality made up of wonderful traits and not so great habits. Today, Lucky Dog takes a look at Brandon's biggest training challenges to teach you that no matter what the issue, there's always a solution.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Out of the Box'' - Every dog presents its own unique set of challenges, and what works in one situation may require a bit more ingenuity in another. Today, Lucky Dog features some of Brandon's most creative training moments- including some "never before seen footage".

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Overcoming Obstacles'' - Age. Experience. Physical limitation. Every dog faces its own unique hurdles in training. But with Brandon's guidance, they're all capable of achieving new heights.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Transformation'' - From makeovers to mindsets —every Lucky Dog goes through its own unique metamorphosis. Today we look back at some of this season's most dramatic, and heartwarming, "transformations."

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''New Skills'' - For five lucky shelter dogs, a forever home is right around the corner. But before they can step into their new lives, they'll all need to embrace "new skills."

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Friendships'' - They're called "Man's Best Friend", but for these five dogs, companionship defies age, size, gender and even species. Today we look back at some of this year's most heartwarming, and surprising, "friendships".

programme.title: How New Orleans Birthed a Vietnamese Po Boy Movement
programme.desc: We head to New Orleans. Forty years ago, Vietnamese migration to NOLA introduced bánh mì to po' boy country. Now, the lines between two iconic sandwiches are blurring. To find out what happens when you mash up the Mississippi Delta and the Mekong Delta, we spoke to New Orleans legend Curren$y, Times-Picayune writer Brett Anderson, and Banh Mi Boys chef Peter Nguyen.

programme.title: Filipino Food 101 With Jo Koy

programme.title: Mike Chen and Claire Saffitz Explore Japanese Street Food and Candy
programme.desc: Japan Village is a 20,000-square-foot food hall in Brooklyn's Industry City, and Reina Scully is ready to explore every corner. But no food tour is complete without a few friends. Joining Reina on her adventure is Strictly Dumpling's Mike Chen, Bon Appétit's Claire Saffitz, and NYC restaurateur Sakura Yagi.

programme.title: Wagyu 101 with Sean Evans and Philip DeFranco
programme.desc: Japan is home to some of the world's most coveted cuts of meat. But what makes wagyu so expensive? From an $85 wagyu sando with Hot Ones host Sean Evans, to a $350 wagyu steak with her old boss Philip DeFranco, Reina Scully is eating her way through NYC's most decadent hunks of Japanese beef with a couple of friends. But what gives wagyu its famously marbled fat? And what's the deal with American wagyu popping up at restaurants?

programme.title: WWE Star Asuka Eats Japanese Eel
programme.desc: Eel is one of the most traditional ingredients in Japanese cooking. But in the U.S., the delicacy is still largely misunderstood. On this episode of Gochi Gang, Reina Scully is embarking on an eel-eating adventure. First, Chef Hiroki Fukushima gives Reina a crash course in the preparation of unagi, or freshwater eel, at Unagi Aburi Ittetsu. And later, Reina teams up with WWE superstar and sushi obsessive Asuka for an omakase experience centered around anago, unagi's saltwater cousin.

programme.title: Meek Mill & Lil Baby Albums, Jay Explains 'What's Free' Line, Em's 'Kick Off'

programme.title: My Pride

programme.title: Dating My Mother
programme.desc: Unemployed and living in his New Jersey hometown, brash screenwriter Danny spends his days practicing yoga, sipping red wine, and power-walking with his mother Joan. But when she reveals she's seeing another man, their version of domestic bliss comes crashing down. DATING MY MOTHER follows the intimate and tumultuous relationship between a single mother and her gay son as they navigate the dizzying world of online dating. While they search for their versions of Mr. Right, mother and son discover that sometimes you need to be apart in order to grow together.

programme.title: Culture Q
programme.desc: S1 E24 | This week on Culture Q we dive into the world of Super Queer-oes, looking at DC's bisexual Superman and trans Wonder Woman character, as well as other upcoming projects like Marvel's The Eternals and Thor: Love and Thunder. Later we take a look at the Netflix employee walkout over Dave Chappelle's special The Closer, hearing from the employees affected as well as stars like Johnathan Van Ness and Our Lady J, before we sit down to interview Bowen Yang about his time on Saturday Night Live. Next, we congratulate Admiral Rachel Levine for becoming the first trans and the first female four-star officer in the US, and then go global looking at mounting tensions in Ghana, Russia, and Afghanistan. Finally we celebrate Jamie Lee Curtis's daughter Ruby coming out as trans, and look at Curtis's history with the Human Rights Campaign, and her upcoming biopic based on the woman who founded the Free Mom Hugs organization.

programme.title: Queens of Kings
programme.desc: Aquaria has had a whirlwind of a year. As the newly crowned winner of Season 10 of RuPaul's Drag Race, she has gone from a New York City icon to an international drag superstar. Aquaria's legendary makeup skills, awe-inspiring looks, and dedication to the craft prove why the Age of Aquaria is upon us. Miz Jade, or the "Queen of Shade" as she's known to her friends, is a legend of the Brooklyn drag community. While she's a talented dancer and budding seamstress, Miz Jade is known for slaying looks, her kind-spirit, and her avante-garde performances. Scarlet Envy has been a mainstay of the Brooklyn drag community for years. Now this sultry songstress is trying something new with the debut of her drag cabaret, Smoke and Mirrors. Scarlet's breathtaking looks and captivating talent will have you "red" with envy.

programme.title: Get Shorty
programme.desc: Loan shark Chili Palmer (John Travolta) has done his time as a gangster. So when "business" takes him to L.A. to collect a debt from down-and-out filmmaker Harry Zimm (Gene Hackman), Chili jumps headfirst into the Hollywood scene: schmoozing a film star (Danny DeVito), romancing a B-movie actress (Rene Russo) and eating at the hottest restaurants in town. In fact, all would be cool for this smooth new producer if it weren't for the drug smugglers and an angry mobster who won't leave him alone!

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Dalton (Patrick Swayze) drives a Mercedes Benz, holds a degree in philosophy from NYU and makes lots of money. He's been shot at, stabbed and has broken most of the bones in his body. He also has a flip side - he's the best bar bouncer in the business. When Dalton's brought in to clean up a popular establishment that has become particularly rowdy, his calm is put to the test by the nasty local kingpin (Ben Gazzara) in this throwback to the great westerns of the 40s and 50s.

programme.title: The Mod Squad
programme.desc: Big screen version of the trend-setting 1960s television series, contemporizing the premise for the '90s. A trio of juvenile delinquents become undercover cops to infiltrate a drug ring in the ultra-hip L.A. club scene.

programme.title: Body of Evidence
programme.desc: Rebecca Carlson (Madonna) is a powerful woman. Intelligent, successful, and beautiful, she can bring almost any man to his knees...right where she wants them. But when a night of unbridled sexual abandon results in the death of a prominent businessman, Rebecca finds herself on trial for murder. Now it's up to her attorney (Willem Dafoe) to prove her innocence...but when he becomes entangled in her web of erotic games, his road to the truth proves to have as many curves as his seductive client!

programme.desc: "Deadly Dive" - A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Decent" - It's up to Dr. G, along with the National Transportation Safety Board, to piece together how and why a plane crashed, leaving the pilot dead.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Deadly Deal" - Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Evil Intent" - Authorities respond to a fire, only to find Carolyn Casey's body at the center of the blaze. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must find the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Disturbing Behavior" - Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Wounded" - A teen is eating breakfast when his dad starts stabbing himself. As the investigation unfolds, police begin to doubt the story. Dr. G must determine if this was a suicide or a murder.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Hidden Killers" - When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Playing With Fire" - Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Bite" - Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Circumstances" - Dario Romano is found dead by his son at the bottom of the attic ladder. What happened to this 45-year-old? With Dr. G's guidance, Dr. Stephany must solve the mystery.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1987, the death of Crystal Purcell was considered an accident. Then in 2001, Barbara Purcell called police to suggest that her estranged husband had killed Crystal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman was dead. The man had been shot four times and survived. When the man's version of events contradicted physical evidence, investigators turned to forensic science.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How did the stalker obtain the security system code for his victim's home? How did he steal her personal photographs? Police needed answers and they found them in the most unlikely of places.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After inspecting storm damage to a home in Tampa, an insurance assessor simply disappeared. Thirty hours later, her body was found in a nearby river. But the killer had been careless.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder trail turned cold, until police got a call from a woman whose husband, Gerald Powers, had a criminal past and a fondness for Chevy Berettas.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, Grand Junction, Colorado is on edge after a series of deadly bombings kill two people and injure one more. Police race to find the culprit before he strikes again.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Lives changed in the 20 years following an unsolved murder, and so did forensic science. In time, a high-powered microscope and DNA profiling revealed a clue no one had seen before.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy socialite died after falling down the stairs, witness accounts contradicted evidence. Investigators employed a physicist and an expert in accident reconstruction.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1997, Kelly Eckart's car was found, with her belongings still in it, after she worked a late shift in Franklin, Indiana. Days later, her body was found in an isolated ravine.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, Derrick Duehren returned to find his Oregon home burned to the ground. His wife's charred remains were later found in the rubble.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A millionaire and his family were executed in their own home. For three years, the murders went unsolved. Finally, a box of ammunition and some fluorescent fibers revealed the ultimate betrayal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young girl was found dead, police quickly arrested the most likely suspect. But cutting-edge technology from NASA enabled a forensic odontologist to prove the wrong man was behind bars.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young fireman died from what appeared to be serious but undiagnosed heart disease, his family and friends were devastated but they had no proof of foul play.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Security cameras in a casino tracked a young woman's movements until shortly before she disappeared. She was never seen again.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a dedicated, well-respected teacher disappeared, police had to determine if she'd gone on vacation without telling anyone, or if she was the victim of foul play.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Seattle police had no suspects in the violent murder of post-grunge singer, Mia Zapata. More than a decade passed before the evidence could be used by forensic scientists to identify the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Michigan State University grad student disappeared and was presumed dead. With the help of a professor of geological sciences, police hoped to get the "dirt" on her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Tall Crappacino" - Four teams of two attempt to win $50,000. They face three extreme stunts as they are stuck in a car being flown under two helicopters, must drink a Fear Factor Crappacino and lastly are dropped through a collapsing tower.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Scorpion Tales" - Four teams of family members compete for $50,000 as they careen into a quarry full of live ammunition while in the back of a truck, must devour nasty scorpions, and are strapped to the front of a cement truck as it smashes through structures.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Burger King Viewers Choice" - Contestants launch over a farmhouse into a pit of mud, evade attack dogs while searching for hubcaps in a junkyard and there is a very large explosion.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Military Fear Factor" - Teams of women and men from the Army, Navy and Air Force compete against each other.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'The Bees Are So Angry, Part 1" - Five teams of two compete for $100,000 dollars on a five stunt, 2 hour spectacular as they are flown underneath the belly of a helicopter, have to eat bees, are launched off a building through glass, deal with the horror of bull testicles and drive a car through the back of a moving semi truck.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'The Bees Are So Angry, Part 2" - Five teams of two compete for $100,000 dollars on a five stunt, 2 hour spectacular as they are flown underneath the belly of a helicopter, have to eat bees, are launched off a building through glass, deal with the horror of bull testicles and drive a car through the back of a moving semi truck.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'Leeches & Shaved Heads & Tear Gas, Part 1" - In a special 2 hour Fear Factor five teams of 2 are bungied off a cliff while tied under a helicopter, must eat leeches, must run through a burning building, deal with the Wheel of Misfortune, and finally grab flags off a moving car while dangling of a crane. All is the hopes of winning $100,000.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'Leeches & Shaved Heads & Tear Gas, Part 2" - In a special 2 hour Fear Factor five teams of 2 are bungied off a cliff while tied under a helicopter, must eat leeches, must run through a burning building, deal with the Wheel of Misfortune, and finally grab flags off a moving car while dangling of a crane. All is the hopes of winning $100,000.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Snake Bite" - Four couples compete for a grand prize of $50,000. In order to win they must face getting catapulted off the top of a tall building, transfer snakes with theirs mouths and transfers flags to a partner hanging under a helicopter, all while riding a personal watercraft.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Roach Coach" - Four teams of two compete for $50,000 as they are locked in a cage and sunk underwater, eat a disgusting meal from the Fear Factor Roach Coach consisting of roaches, grasshoppers, blood salsa and maggots and lastly must leap back and forth from a moving station wagon onto a bus.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Broken Hearts & Blood Baths" - Four teams of exes must deal with 3 stunts and each other. In order to win $50,000 they must launch a car into a lake while being strapped in, dive for cow hearts in thousands of gallons of blood, and deal with the most difficult Fear Factor stunt ever as they run, fly, swim and climb while trying to blow up a fueling station.

programme.title: Watts on the Grill
programme.desc: Chef/TV personality Spencer Watts demonstrates how to barbeque anything, from steak and chicken, to seafood and breads, like a pro.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Chef Ned Bell makes Salt Cod, fish lasagna, and fish cakes.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Chef McRobert's makes baked Alaska, summer pudding, and lemon meringue pie.

programme.title: The Latin Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Luis shares the secrets to four irresistible street food recipes.

programme.title: Pork Two Ways
programme.desc: Test cook Becky Hays makes host Bridget Lancaster Perfect Pan-Seared Pork Tenderloin Steaks. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for air fryers, and test cook Dan Souza makes a showstopping Crispy Slow-Roasted Pork Belly for Julia.

programme.title: Thanksgiving from the Grill
programme.desc: We move the turkey out of the oven and onto the grill, freeing up precious cooking space for other Thanksgiving dishes and giving us a better tasting bird. Our sweet potatoes and cranberry sauce have all the flavor and texture that make them must-have holiday side dishes.

programme.title: Chicken in a Flash
programme.desc: Simple yet interesting, both chicken Milanese and chicken piccata are reliable test kitchen favorites. And we're intrigued by recipes that pan-roast chicken parts-that is, start them on the stovetop but finish the cooking in the oven. Our goal was to make this chef's technique work at home.

programme.title: Salad 101
programme.desc: Many Greek salads are no more than iceberg lettuce topped with an overly acidic dressing and a few crumbs of feta cheese. And spinach salad is also often drowned in an oily, bland dressing and sprinkled with minuscule bacon bits. We set out to create flavorful, fresh-tasting versions of these two salads.

programme.title: Pot Roast
programme.desc: When it comes out right, pot roast is tender, succulent, and richly flavored. When it turns out wrong, the meat is dry, gray, tough, and full of fat and sinew. Good pot roast begins at the market, and we've found that cooking technique matters just as much as the cut.

programme.title: Regional Classics
programme.desc: Some local dishes become so popular that they transcend their region. Gumbo is a taste of Louisiana in a big old bowl. And Cincinnati chili is American original, served with buttered spaghetti, kidney beans, cheddar cheese, and chopped onions. Our goal when developing our versions of these dishes was to remain faithful to the originals while making the recipes approachable for cooks who may not have grown up with them.

programme.title: Winter Supper
programme.desc: Osso buco, literally "bone with a hole,'' is the Italian term for veal shanks. This meaty cut, akin to beef shanks or lamb shanks, becomes meltingly tender when stewed for several hours in a covered pot. Our goal was to create a recipe that guaranteed perfectly tender meat with rich flavor. We serve it with a simple and satisfying polenta.

programme.title: Summer Fruit Desserts
programme.desc: Summer desserts are all about fruit. As inviting as an icy wedge of watermelon or a bowl of sweet berries can be, there's something about baked fruit desserts that we can't resist. In this episode we take a look at two summer favorites: blueberry cobbler and free-form fruit tart.

programme.title: Eggs for Brunch
programme.desc: Excellent egg dishes shouldn't require the talents of a short-order cook. Our hearty frittata is just as filling as an omelet, but a whole lot easier to prepare and serve. We also uncover the formula for the ideal quiche filling and deliver a tender, buttery pastry crust filled with moist, smooth custard.

programme.title: Rainy Day Barbecue
programme.desc: If the weather is too poor for grilling and a hankering for ribs strikes, is the only choice a trip to a local barbecue joint? Or could we find the answer in the home kitchen?

programme.title: Faster Family Favorites
programme.desc: With these quick recipes, you'll be able to get dinner on the table in a reasonable amount of time. We make a fresh-tasting, quick tamale pie with a juicy, spicy mixture of meat and vegetables and a quick homemade-cornbread topping. We also show you how to cook up a really flavorful chicken stew topped with a biscuit crust.

programme.title: Beef Dressed Up
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make perfect Spice-Crusted Steaks. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top pick of electric griddles. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of supermarket bacon. Finally, test cook Ashley Moore and Julia reveal a showstopping recipe for Grilled Bacon Burgers with Caramelized Onion.

programme.title: Roast Beef and Potatoes
programme.desc: Test cook Natalie Estrada reveals the secrets to making a foolproof Classic Roast Beef Tenderloin with host Bridget Lancaster. Next, host Julia Collin Davison discovers equipment expert Adam Ried's top pick of tongs. Finally, test cook Lawman Johnson shows Julia how to make perfect Lyonnaise Potatoes.

programme.title: Pork Tacos and Churros
programme.desc: Julia Collin Davison prepares showstopping Citrus-Braised Pork Tacos. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a mild salsa taste test. Next, test cook Christie Morrison shows Julia how to make unforgettable So-Cal-inspired Churros. And finally, equipment expert Adam Ried shares his favorite piping set.

programme.title: BBQ Thighs and Fried Peach Pies
programme.desc: Julia Collin Davison unveils the secrets to the ultimate Barbecue Chicken Thighs to host, Bridget Lancaster. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of popcorn. And finally, test cook Bryan Roof demonstrates how to make Fried Peach Pies at home.

programme.title: Tex-Mex Favorites
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster make a Lone Star State classic-Flank Steak in Adobo. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for inexpensive blenders. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Julia how to make the ultimate Texas Breakfast Tacos.

programme.title: Spaghetti House Classics
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison makes host Julia Collin Davison the perfect Hearty Beef Lasagna. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of block mozzarella. And finally, test cook Lan Lam makes Bridget a new weeknight favorite-Chicken Scarpariello.

programme.title: Korean Feast
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make dolsot bibimbap. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews spider skimmers in the equipment corner. Finally, test cook Dan Souza prepares Korean-style fried chicken wings.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Cookies for Everyone / I Biscotti Per Tutti
programme.desc: And Mary Ann means everyone, as she and her young assistant, Calliope, prepare multi-purpose doughs that deliver a mountain of different vanilla and chocolate biscotti combinations, some filled with diced, dried fruit, others with slivered almonds. Then Mary Ann teached Calliope how to make light-as-cloud Amaretti di Mombaruzzo.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - The Tomato Whisperer
programme.desc: Chef Stellino explores the complexities of the tomato. Dishes include: Tomato Salad (Cherry tomatoes with mozzarella and onions) / Tonno alla Puttanesca (Tuna steaks with a special tomato sauce) / Blueberry Crumble.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - The Long Walk
programme.desc: In this episode, Cecilia joins Laurence Jossel, chef and owner of Nopa. Like Cecilia, South African-born Jossel came a long way to open a restaurant in San Francisco. Cecilia shows Laurence how to make “beggar’s chicken,” a whole, stuffed chicken wrapped in lotus leaves and then clay, and baked for at least two hours.

programme.title: From Scratch - Pizza
programme.desc: Today, Chef Joe prepares fresh cheese and sausages for a PIZZA party with friends and family.

programme.title: Foodie Road Trip with Skye Estroff - Casting the Net Wide on Tybee Island
programme.desc: Tybee Island is home to fun locals, a deep history, and, of course, seafood so delicious that it, alone, was enough reason for Skye to make a return trip.

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Mexican Chicken
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking Mexican chicken, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Lamb Potato Casserole & Lamb Patties
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to prepare and cook Lamb Potato Casserole & Lamb Patties!

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Sugar and Honey
programme.desc: Sticky sweetness highlights this segment of Hawaii Cooks. A visit to Manoa Honey Company reveals how this golden by-product of bees is harvested, while at the same time ensuring that Hawaii’s agricultural industry remains pollinated. Although sugar once dominated the agricultural landscape in Hawaii, sugar production has now dwindled down to two locations on Kauai and Maui.

programme.title: Graham Kerr's Kitchen - Fried Rice
programme.desc: Seasoned rice and wheat berries stir-fried with Canadian bacon, sun-dried tomatoes, green onions and eggs are served as a main course or rolled in tender collard leaves and served with salsa.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Empire Kitchen Pop’s for Italian Detroit Axe
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Musonda Mwila, Michael Sanders and Michelle Dritsan, who review bistro fare and craft cocktails at the Empire Kitchen true Italian fare with homemade pasta, of course, at Pop's for Italian and a casual menu of eats at the high-energy Detroit Axe restaurant.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Galápagos Islands
programme.desc: Chef Staib journeys to the famed Galápagos Islands. He explores the vast wildlife, samples coffee produced from volcanic soil, and tastes the local ceviche made from an endemic species of the islands.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - A Meal to Impress
programme.desc: Martin and his guest, Michael Lomonaco, show us how to impress your friends and be the life of any dinner party with these unique dishes.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Tomatoes
programme.desc: Take Tomatoes to the next level with Mushroom and Tomato Bell Pepper Quiche, Spicy Corn Tomato Relish, Tomato Basil Salad.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Kaspar Donier, Kevin Rathbun, and Keegan Gerhard
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Pickled Chanterelles, Boar Chops and Cous Cous, and Roasted Apples with Warm Apple Soup. Restaurants include: Kaspar’s in Seattle, Nava in Atlanta, and The Ritz-Carlton in Naples.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Noodle and Dumpling Chronicles
programme.desc: Like an Italian with a bowl of spaghetti or tortellini, a Korean eating a heap of noodles or dumplings is a satisfied customer. In Korea, slurping is not only permitted, it’s considered a compliment to the cook. This episode features a restaurant in Seoul known for its nenngymyun, an unusual dish of elastic buckwheat noodles served with ice-cold beef broth.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Santa Fe Trail
programme.desc: Chef Staib journeys down the Santa Fe trail through Kansas to discover where travelers regrouped before the next perilous leg of their journey. Recipes like steamed venison pudding and bison stew are prepared at a local stagecoach stop.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - The Real Chefs Garden
programme.desc: In this episode we experience Seattle’s most pure, organic, direct and delicious “Farm to Table” experience with Chef Brian Scheehser. He practices sustainable farming in his own three‐acre garden, with the hand of a farmer and the meticulous nature of a chef. Part Chef‐Part Farmer, Scheehser offers expert tips on cooking and insight on how to grow your garden.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Rice Chronicles
programme.desc: Rice, the bread and butter of the Korean table is explored from Busan, Korea’s second largest city, all the way to Seoul. Along the way, Marja and her dear friend, the actress Heather Graham, learn about instant rice, tteok (a pasta-like ingredient made of ground rice) and visit Bibigo, a new chain of contemporary restaurants serving fresh variations of bibimbap.

programme.title: Refugee Chef - Redefining Shangri-Lai
programme.desc: Chef Dorjee was a Tibetan Buddhist monk before he settled down in USA. He decided the best way to answer the question of 'Where are you from?' is to give someone a taste of his homeland. Dorjee Momos, a refugee-owned, family-run Tibetan nomad food start-up, was born.

programme.title: Refugee Chef - Aleppo Super Club
programme.desc: Haunted by the horrors of being jailed, tortured and losing his family in Syria, Ahmad finds refuge in London. To survive, he does anything and everything, including cook. As word-of-mouth of his home cooking spread, he started Aleppo Supper Club, a pop-up restaurant and catering service.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Welcome to Mexico
programme.desc: In the first episode, Peter kicks off his adventure at the US border in the state of Chihuahua. He gets his first real taste of Tex Mex in the form of a burrito, before cooking a mouth-watering take on an old favourite - Chilli con Carne.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Fishing, Fun and Tacos
programme.desc: Having explored the beef territory of northern Mexico, it's time to head for some seafood as Peter Kuruvita descends 2000 metres by train to explore Mexico's Pacific coast - home of prawns, giant oysters and the original fish tacos.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - The Big Smoke
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in his first big Mexican city Guadalajara, where he will sample a classic slow cooked goat dish known as Birria, before heading to the iconic town of Tequila and going behind the scenes at a boutique distillery.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - The Real Mexico
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita gets to know the real Mexico, traveling to the ghost town of Real de Catorce in search of peyote, before heading south to the romantic town of Guanajuato to learn how to make the most ubiquitous of all Mexican food, tortillas.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Megacity
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in one of the largest metropolises on earth, Mexico City, discovering a city of extremes with high end dining sitting side by side with some of the cheapest and tastiest street food in the world.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - That’s a molé!
programme.desc: Contrary to popular opinion, molé is not just a chilli chocolate sauce, although molé poblano is the most well-known and this episode sees Peter Kuruvita learn the secrets to this incredibly complicated concoction.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Cambodia: Water Filters Delivery
programme.desc: Host Khai Saharom takes on a special delivery - sponsoring and bringing water filters to a rural village to help combat and solve the problem. The journey promises to be eventful as Khai must himself drive the truck carrying the filters.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Vietnam: Cow Delivery
programme.desc: Host Greta Georges is in Vietnam on a special delivery mission for World Vision, a humanitarian organization dedicated to tackling the root causes of poverty.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Nepal: School Reconstruction
programme.desc: Host Paul Foster hooks up with his Nepalese friends to undertake a tough, dangerous and exhilarating 14 hour drive up the mountains in a special delivery of masonry that will help rebuild schools and bring the children back into the classroom.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Sri Lanka: Soccer Boots Delivery
programme.desc: Host Pei Fen lugs her special delivery of boots onto a train - for the long ride from Colombo to Kilinochchi - eager to help the girls put the tragic past behind and look forward to a brighter future.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Vietnam: Postal Service
programme.desc: Host Daniel Hutchinson joins the postman in delivering personal packages to the families but not before embarking on an arduous journey to where the tribes are situated.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Laos: Medical Supplies Delivery
programme.desc: Host Carla Dunareanu partners with "Bridging the Gap Mekong Trust" to travel upriver to a remote village in her special delivery of mosquito-nets and precious medical supplies.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Malaysia: Tools for a Better Life
programme.desc: Host Paul Foster journeys up the Tembeling River and into the primeval forest in search of just such a community from the Batek tribe. His mission, to deliver rice and clothes to the Batek to help them cope as their way of life is threatened by modernity.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Indonesia: Horse Mobile Library
programme.desc: Host Khai Saharom joins Ridwan Sururi in this endearing and noble effort to bring books to the villagers. On his journey, he meets Lasmi, a very shy young autistic girl whom Ridwan has successfully taught to read.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Thailand: A Life Changing Climb
programme.desc: n this episode, Host Carla Dunareanu travels to Bangkok to meet an extraordinary father-son pair.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Brick and Mortar
programme.desc: An old fireplace houses a new stove. Tommy discusses using interior casework with exposed brick. Roger tours hidden gardens. Demolition continues while Tommy and Judith look at flooring options.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Southern Roots
programme.desc: A foundation starts while Roger tries to save a crepe myrtle. Kevin visits Fort Sumter. The single house mantel and windows get restored and the old kitchen house gets connected to the main house.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Good Wood
programme.desc: Kevin meets a lumberjack. Tommy watches how pipes are disguised, and Richard seeks out places for HVAC equipment. Kevin learns about Single Houses. A crepe myrtle gets pruned and Tommy talks termites.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Rough Plumbing
programme.desc: Richard works on plumbing at the Elliotborough house while Kevin meets a kitchen designer. The porch gets assessed. A floor goes down at the single house. Tommy and Mark snake wires through a wall.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Smithies
programme.desc: The old piazza columns get restored. The iron gate is made by blacksmith students at a local college. Lights are selected for an old house. New siding mixes with old to meet historic district codes.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Rainbow Row
programme.desc: Charleston boasts a colorful housing stock. Judith decides on a siding color for the Elliotborough project. Kevin meets her and a design expert in a neighborhood famous for house colors, Rainbow Row.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Raise the Pergola
programme.desc: The pergola goes up. Ross looks at smart home technology. A local craftsman puts the finishing touches on a dining table. Richard checks out the HVAC plan while repointing starts on the fireplaces.

programme.title: The Charleston Houses 2018 | Singular Single House
programme.desc: The iron gate is fitted at the Charleston Single House. Kevin, Tom, and Richard tour the renovations. Richard visits the Elliotborough project for updates. The completion of the project is celebrated.

programme.desc: Jenn installs a plunge pool for a homeowner with a small backyard Tom gives some basic tips about insulating an attic Richard travels to Celebration, Florida to help a homeowner select and install the right electric water heater.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Greek Goddess Bride
programme.desc: David Tutera's next bride thinks her fiance is a Greek god and that means a Greek themed wedding. But her idea of statues, golden centerpieces and white loose robes suggests to David he'll have to tread with caution.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Phantom of the Opera Bride
programme.desc: David's newest bride is hoping to recreate the glamour and drama of The Phantom of the Opera, but her execution is something out of a high school play. Can David save this production?

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Alice in Wonderland Bride
programme.desc: With his new bride's heart set on an Alice in Wonderland themed wedding, David Tutera has to help her dark and dreary concept into an elegant and modern take on the classic tale.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Wizard of Oz Bride
programme.desc: David Tutera meets a bride whose Wizard of Oz themed wedding has him spinning in circles. Does David's bride have the courage and heart to deal with all of his changes?

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Monopoly Bride
programme.desc: David Tutera assists a bride who is trying to incorporate the board game Monopoly into her wedding. David takes on this huge challenge and gets right to work to make the classic board game come to life at her wedding.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Goth Bride
programme.desc: Bride Kristina wants a Goth wedding complete with spiders, skulls and even an all-black wedding dress! David Tutera wants to lighten up the festivities, but first he'll have to convince the bride to try on a little wedding white.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Motown Bride
programme.desc: Bride Sashani dreamed of being a pop star. Now she wants a Motown wedding. David Tutera creates a triple platinum event, featuring over-the-top sequined gowns, wall-to-wall music and a Grammy-award-winning star!

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Masquerade Bride
programme.desc: Bride Berda is getting married on Halloween. Her wedding decor features plastic pumpkins, spider webs, and skulls. David Tutera transforms her ticky-tacky theme into an elegant masquerade ball.

programme.title: Bridezillas: Zilla Porsha - Extra Large and in Charge
programme.desc: Personal Trainer Donna Sexton has some heavy lifting to do when it comes to helping former Bridezilla Porsha lose weight. With some extra-large junk in her trunk and a cheating husband, can our trainer help Porsha shed her baggage?

programme.desc: A team of women in Oklahoma are moms by day and ghost hunters by night.

programme.title: Ghosts in the Hood: Scared Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Defecio and his team investigate a drive thru mortuary that is being haunted by a member of its past. Meanwhile, a hoarder's haven inhabits a cursed artifact, along with too much junk in general.

programme.title: Ghosts in the Hood: Menace 2 South Central
programme.desc: When a pinata shop grows suspicious of a paranormal presence, the O.P.O jumps in to offer their services. On the other end of town, a Family Fun Zone experiences late night waves of sudden illness.

programme.title: Ghosts in the Hood: Don't Play with Santa Muerte
programme.desc: The O.P.O. is on edge when rumors of Santa Muerte begin to circulate near a haunted grocery store. Meanwhile, a heavy metal venue in Anaheim is suspecting paranormal behavior from within its past.

programme.title: Ghosts in the Hood: Inglewood Always Up to No Good
programme.desc: A sexy realtor calls the O.P.O. into action, fearing that an unwanted demon would repel any potential homeowners. Meanwhile, a cantina is beginning to experience a fiery spirit moving across its dance floors!

programme.title: Ghosts in the Hood: Ain't Nothing But A Redwood G Thang

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 1, Day Ten" - In the season finale, the final two — with some help from the eliminated chefs — compete in a simulation that tests their abilities to run a restaurant.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day One" - Twelve chefs begin their journeys for the final prize: an executive chef position at the newly opened Red Rock Casino, Resort and Spa in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Two" - After a disastrous opening night, both teams learn the hard way about the importance of restaurant service — by waiting on tables.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Three" - Frustrated after another lackluster dinner service, Chef Ramsay shares some of his experiences running a successful restaurant while setting the third night's competition.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Four" - Chef Ramsay ends the battle of the sexes, and "Hell's Kitchen" breaks new ground when the teams cook for an especially demanding group: children.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Five" - The fifth day commences with Chef Ramsay giving a lesson in the art of culinary flavor to the remaining contestants.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Six" - The six remaining chefs prepare original dishes, and the two teams devise their own menus for the night's dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Seven " - The budding chefs must work as individuals for the first time. The prize for this challenge is a trip with Chef Ramsay to the Red Rock Casino, Resort and Spa.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Eight" - With just four chefs remaining, the competition becomes fierce. Who among them has what it takes to be head chef at Gordon Ramsay's new restaurant?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Nine" - The contestants taste Chef Ramsay's signature dish and are given twenty minutes to replicate it. Tensions rise amongst the chefs amidst accusations of cheating.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Ten (Part One)" - From the menu to the décor, the two finalists must prove their worth by running their own restaurants. Both will complete a dinner service with help from their former competitors.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Fiesta Sunrise
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay helps out a family-run Mexican restaurant called Fiesta Sunrise — which is in deep financial trouble and extremely dirty. Can Ramsay get the family on the path to success?

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Spin a Yarn
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits a fifty-year-old steakhouse. Despite the restaurant's rich history, it's long overdue for a visual and culinary makeover.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Yanni's
programme.desc: In Seattle, Chef Ramsay hopes to improve a family-owned Greek restaurant that resists catering to the changing demographic of the neighborhood.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Trobiano's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay tries to help Italian restaurant Trobiano's. When Ramsay confronts the owner about the cleanliness of the kitchen and the tastiness of the food, tensions rise.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Handlebar
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mount Sinai, New York to help spruce up Bill and Carolyn LeRoy's Handlebar restaurant and lounge, which looks like it's stuck in the 1980s.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Fleming
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Fleming, a Danish eatery in Miami. The stubborn owner doesn't want to update the place and Ramsay discovers something in the cooler that leads him to close the restaurant.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Dillon's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is in the Big Apple to revamp Dillon's, an Indian restaurant just blocks away from his own thriving eatery. Stubborn owner Mohammed loses approximately $25,000-$50,000 a month.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Park's Edge
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay stops at Park's Edge in Atlanta, where he finds a chaotic kitchen and severe signs of mismanagement.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Bella Luna
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay assists a family-owned Italian restaurant in Easton, Philadelphia that's struggling due to the chef's incompetence and the owner's aloofness.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Peter's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Peter's, a family-run Italian restaurant in Babylon, New York. He discovers that the eatery is sinking because of its brash manager and co-owner.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Lido di Manhattan
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Lido di Manhattan, an Italian joint with an unsightly kitchen and inexperienced owner. He is so horrified that he shuts the place down temporarily.

programme.desc: Después de la caída de un infame narco-líder, el coronel Diana está lista para tomarse un descanso de la policía y trabajar para arreglar su matrimonio. Su jefe, sin embargo, tiene otros planes y le asigna al coronel Diana su mayor misión hasta la fecha: desmantelar "el Clan del Norte" dirigido por los hermanos Zurria y sus aliados oficiales corruptos y funcionarios del gobierno.

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E198
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE is singer-songwriter Kwon Jin-ah! This artist became known to the public in 2013 after taking part in "K-Pop Star Season 3." 3 years later in 2016, she made her official debut with the album, "One Strange Night," and topped all the music charts with the lead single "The End." Particularly known for her delicate ability to express emotions, she has collaborated with various top-notch musicians and also taken part in many soundtracks. This past February, Kwon Jin-ah released her first collaborative single with Gaeko, "I Feel Like," and dominated the top spots of music charts again. February was definitely a busy month for this artist - she also released her EP, "The Way For Us." Due to her active participation in the creative process both as a songwriter and producer, the album beautifully displays her distinct musicality. She likens each of her songs in the EP to a short story, making her new album a collection of 6 short stories. In this episode, Kwon Jin-ah performs "Something's Wrong," "Flower Heart," "You already have," "Good Bye," "I got lucky," and The way for Us." Tune in to I'm LIVE and enjoy her beautiful songs!

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E178
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE are the beloved monkies of the Korean music industry - JANNABI! JANNABI is an old-fashioned Korean word for “monkey,” and this band made their debut in 2014 with the digital single, "Rocket." Since then, they have impressed numerous listeners with their retro-infused music that portrays various stories of the youth, ranging from love to separation to frustration. Last year, the band released their second full-length album, "Legend," and topped all the music charts with the album's lead track "for lovers who hesitate." Before releasing their third full-length album next year, the band dropped a new mini-album just a week ago, and this time as a duo, to nourish listeners' hearts. In this episode, JANNABI performs both their latest tracks and hit songs - "A thought on an autumn night," "Old dog," "Sweet memories," and "Step" from their new album, "JANNABI's Small Pieces 1," as well as "Summer," and "for lovers who hesitate." Tune in to I'm LIVE this week and enjoy a beautiful autumn day with these talented musicians!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Steve Bruner - Simply Put
programme.desc: Steve Bruner looks like a perfectly normal guy—until he opens his mouth. He’s delivered his laser-sharp humor on Comedy Club Network (Showtime), An Evening at the Improv (A&E), Into the Night (ABC), and The Byron Allen Show (NBC), to name a few.

programme.title: Joe Devito - First Of All
programme.desc: Joe DeVito's dead-on timing and unexpected twists make him a favorite at comedy clubs across the USA. His TV appearances include The Late Late Show, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central, Comics Unleashed, and AXStv’s Gotham Comedy Live. He’s also a regular on TV news panels, finding the funny in pop culture and current events. Joe’s albums First Date with Joe DeVito and Three’s Comedy are in regular rotation on SiriusXM radio.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jeff Shaw - Manly Girly Man
programme.desc: Jeff Shaw's writing is marked both by idealism and humanity. His stimulating satire is often infused with poetic beauty. More importantly, he looks like Rod Stewart.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Robert G. Lee - Laughter's Still Legal!
programme.desc: Proud smart aleck Robert G. Lee jokes about performing in a prison, Millennial baseball, and over-protective parents.

programme.title: Robert Mac - Know More
programme.desc: Robert's award-winning comedy is smart, subtle, and silly. Not too smart and not too subtle, but occasionally a bit more silly than youíd expect. And always clean. Robert is a regular at some of the finest comedy clubs around the country. Winner of "Comedy Centralís Laugh Riots." Finalist at "Billy Crystalís Mr. Saturday Night Contest", "San Francisco International Comedy Competition", "Boston Comedy Festival", "Jerry Lewis MDA Telethon Talent Search."

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Tyler Boeh - Wait For It
programme.desc: Who goes from being a mild-mannered nationally recognized college a Capella group vocal percussionist to becoming a high-energy, intelligent, physical, and downright silly beatboxing comedian? None other than Comedian Tyler Boeh, who shifted his focus from singing a Capella (a word he describes as Latin for “Without Girlfriend”) when he won a comedy contest in Portland Oregon. After winning and placing in the finals of numerous Comedy Competitions from San Francisco to Seattle to Boston to The World Series of Comedy, Boeh not only launched a great career in comedy including television appearances, colleges, cruise ships and headlining clubs, he also found a girlfriend. Tyler’s comedy CD was chosen by LaughSpin Magazine as the Best Comedy Album of 2012 and you may have seen him on such shows as Celebrity Name Game, Moms Rule, Nesn Comedy All Stars, or heard him on SIRIUS radio. Don’t miss a chance to see Tyler live.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: K-Von - Designer Muscles
programme.desc: Half-Persian and raised in a religious family, K-Von's comedy unites sharp cultural riffs with clean delivery. In this special he takes on political correctness, cyber bullying, and the utility of cargo pants.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Maher Matta - Personally Speaking
programme.desc: Born in Lebanon and raised in the American South, Maher Matta jokes about flying while Arab, using Rogaine at fifteen, and working as a state trooper.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Dave Nihill - Documented
programme.desc: Dave is the winner of the prestigious 43rd annual San Francisco Comedy Competition, and runner up in the Moth’s largest US Grandslam storytelling competition.

programme.title: Daren Streblow - Organic and Inorganic Life
programme.desc: Daren Streblow’s unique style of observational stand-up comedy has been entertaining hundreds-of-thousands of people throughout the United States and around the world since he first stepped on the stage in 1995. Daren headlines churches, fundraisers, corporate functions, and colleges all over North America. He’s a “humor opportunist” who is always looking for the comical side of life and how people live it. He takes topics that everyone can relate to and filters them through his unique lens where connecting A to B leads to a letter in the Greek alphabet or maybe salad dressing.

programme.title: Leland Klassen - More True
programme.desc: Raised on a farm in the heart of Canada, Leland quickly learned that shoveling manure and weeding potatoes, although lucrative, wasnít his passion in life. So with absolutely no clear direction or vision for his future, he did what everyone does when they find themselves in that position - he went to University. He wisely chose his classes based on whichever cute girl happened to catch his attention and after several short years of last minute cramming and late assignments, Leland graduated from the University of Saskatchewan with a degree in Anthropology. As you might have guessed, Lelandís university education opened many doors for him in the years to come, but for some reason he was dissatisfied working for a courier as a night shift stock boy. By this time married and with his first child soon on the way, the most responsible and obvious choice was, of course, to pursue a career in the entertainment industry. Starting off at amateur nights and seedy bars Leland decided right from the beginning that he would remain clean despite what everyone else was doing and as a result over the last 16 years Leland has become recognized as Canadaís premier clean comedian. With his unique intelligence and wit, Leland has carved out quite a niche for himself in the world of entertainment. Using his farm boy charm and handsome (although somewhat inbred) Mennonite good looks, Lelandís clever observations and rich life experiences are brought to life in a one-of-a-kind show. LELANDíS CREDITS: Halifax Comedy Fest 2014, Just for Laughs in Montreal, 1999, 2001, 2004 and 2014, Host of Popcorn TV, Featured on Thou Shalt Laugh 5, Host of Comedy Tournament, Co-Host GMA Canada 2009, 2012 and 2013, Promise Keepers Canada, Episode of the US syndicated comedy series ìBananasî, Two of his own television seriesí on the West Coast, as well as Appeared on numerous other programs across the United States and Canada, such as Comedy Network, CBC Television, YTV, Star TV, Global and Discovery Kids.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: John Branyan - Demeaning of Life
programme.desc: John Branyan's comedy is smart and sarcastic in perfect proportions. This special features his perspective on why God made everyone stupid and his unparalleled Shakespearean take on The Three Little Pigs.

programme.title: Jeff Allen - I Can Laugh About it Now
programme.desc: Jeff Allen combines clean, hilarious humor like no other comedian working today. Besides performing at corporate functions and fundraisers, he regularly appears on television, radio, and casinos across the country. Consistently making heroes out of meeting planners, Jeff Allen provides world-class comedy.

programme.title: Billy Anderson - America's Sweetheart
programme.desc: Born in Texas and raised in Augusta, Georgia ñ Billy Anderson is stand-up comedian currently living in Seattle, Washington. Heís been seen regionally at SketchFest Seattle, The Washington Comedy Festival, Bumbershoot and was a finalist in the 2016 Seattle International Comedy Competition. Outside of the Northwest, Billy has written for Cracked.Com, performed in SF Sketchfest, LaLaFest Los Angeles, the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and as of 2013 he has performed stand-up comedy in every US state. Billy was recently featured on Audibleís ìSounds Like Americaî hosted by Jackie Kashian and the syndicated program ìLaughsî on Fox television.

programme.title: Dan Levy: Lion
programme.desc: From his personal trainer texting him at 4am, to watching the movie "Frozen" with his kids at 6am.

programme.title: Jermaine Fowler: Give 'Em Hell, Kid
programme.desc: Comedian Jermaine Fowler performs his first ever stand-up special, poking fun at his life in hilarious detail.

programme.title: Alice Wetterlund: My Mama Is A Human And So Am I
programme.desc: Follow comedian / actor Alice Wetterlund as she reveals her personal struggles with peeping toms, cat-rearing.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Minding The Monsters
programme.desc: Minding the Monsters brings together your favorites-- Walter, Peanut, Bubba J, Jose Jalapeno...

programme.title: RIFFTRAX PRESENTS - Horror Express
programme.desc: A frozen monster being transported via the trans-Siberian express breaks free and starts killing off the passengers. Join Matthew J. Elliot as he take a hilarious ride on the Horror Express!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Don't Be a Bloody Idiot
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this 1970s Australian camping safety short. Join Mike, Kevin, Bill and one angry Australian with a gun for Don't Be a Bloody Idiot.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - The Last Slumber Party
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this movie about a psychopath who crashes a teen's slumber party. The fashion is 80s, the soundtrack is hair metal, the poster on the wall is inexplicably of Sesame Street, and the Shelley Hack references are more abundant than every other RiffTrax we’ve ever done combined. Slip into your footie pajamas and join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for The Last Slumber Party!

programme.title: RiffTrax Shorts: It Must Be The Neighbors
programme.desc: Take a journey of neighborly blame with three of the finger-pointingist, buck-passingist neighbors you know— Mike, Kevin and Bill as they riff It Must Be The Neighbors!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Manos The Hands Of Fate (studio)
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K riff the classic Manos - the Hands of Fate! Run, don’t stumble-walk-with-accursed-goat-legs to watch RiffTrax: Manos The Hands Of Fate!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Drugs Are Like That
programme.desc: There are so many things to which drugs can be compared that to even attempt to catalog them would be an act of incomprehensible madness. Yet in this pastel colored, 1970's nightmare, two hard-of-hearing, loggorrheic pre-teens are up to the task! Have you always wondered, Are drugs like pumpkins? Like small willow saplings? Like those bags of cotton candy you can buy in gift shops? Find out as Mike, Kevin and Bill go once more unto the breach!

programme.title: RiffTrax: The Power
programme.desc: Join Mike, Kevin, Bill, and a harmless little tiki idol that Kevin brought back from Hawaii for The Power! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Alone At Home
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to the short Alone at Home! Mike, Kevin, and Bill have not been Alone at Home for years, because their wives know they’d just eat sticks of butter and wind up sticking their fingers in the electrical outlets again.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Families: Earning And Spending
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to the educational short Families: Earning And Spending! Join Mike, Kevin and Bill and spend a little well-earned time with Families: Earning and Spending!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX LIVE - Space Mutiny
programme.desc: Space Mutiny! The very title conjures up many memories: tiny cars, writhing spandex-witches, deadly railings. Oh, and we guess there's a mutiny in there somewhere...This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).
